intro: Phanera wuzhengyii, commonly known as the Wuzheng yin tree, is a rare and endemic plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology and showy floral structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions with high humidity. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and they bloom during the spring season. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Phanera wuzhengyii is considered a conservation concern.
